channel.title: Ubuntu? Awesome!
channel.description:
So i recently switched to Ubuntu, and god i am amazed, this thing runs 3x faster than my windows and i can make video's of my screen instead of slideshows. I'm also quite amazed on how user-friendly it is, it's so easy to install a program.
I recommend this to anyone.

item.title: Ubuntu? Awesome!
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch2 Java Is My Bitch
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch2 wrote:

[quote=“rip4d, post:92, topic:415078”][quote author=Java Is My Bitch link=topic=517037.msg3770139#msg3770139 date=1317594948]

[quote author=Hot_Potato link=topic=517037.msg3767805#msg3767805 date=1317405224]
Ubuntu on my PC runs much faster, much more silent (i’m really surprised, my PC is so loud!) and much more to list.
It also takes a couple of secounds to shut down, comparing it to my PC, around 3-4 mins.
[/quote]More silent? Are you sure the driver for your fan is set up?
[/quote]I’ve actually noticed the same thing too. My fan still works as I can hear it spinning, but it doesn’t spin nearly as fast as it would while I’m running windows.[/quote]If the fan spins at the same speed all the time, even when your CPU usage is high, then there’s a possibility that your fan may not be supported by the default drivers.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu? Awesome!

[/quote]

Download Windows and install it as usual. Select to erase the entire hard drive.

Although, I don’t understand what you’re so worked up over.[/quote]I’m just a lazy fucker and don’t want to take the time to learn how to convert bat to sh but i guess it doesn’t matter now anyways i lost my usb

item.title: Ubuntu? Awesome!
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote="`Alec, post:2, topic:415193"]Ubuntu is great and all, but I don’t think it’s any better than other Linux distros like Fedora, Debian, Gentoo, etc… Maybe more user friendly, but not the best. Not going to go with the flow and bash Windows or Mac, I could care less. That isn’t to say that I like Windows/Mac though… I am a Linux.[/quote]I prefer it over Fedora and Gentoo because of it’s package manager. I also prefer it over Debian because it’s a ton easier to use. Not that I can’t use Gentoo, Debian etc. I just prefer to use Ubuntu

BTW, how much less could you care?

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu? Awesome!
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote=“Java Is My Bitch, post:77, topic:415078”][quote author=rip4d link=topic=517037.msg3765520#msg3765520 date=1317207184]

[quote author=Java Is My Bitch link=topic=517037.msg3765041#msg3765041 date=1317167427]

[quote author=rip4d link=topic=517037.msg3765038#msg3765038 date=1317167017]
That’s what I’m talking about… I failed at tutorials for installing java ._.
[/quote]What? You’re kidding right? Search java in the Ubuntu software center, and install… You don’t even have to add a new repository.
[/quote]Yeah, but that’s 6u22, I was trying to install 6u27 from java.com xD
[/quote]The package on the website should execute fine as well, what’s the problem?[/quote]Trying to get a java directory to work was just being a bitch. Tried making a java folder in the file system, but I couldn’t

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu? Awesome!
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch2 Java Is My Bitch
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch2 wrote:

[quote=“ziplock, post:67, topic:415078”][quote author=Java Is My Bitch link=topic=517037.msg3763031#msg3763031 date=1317001322]

[quote author=RSCShadow link=topic=517037.msg3762828#msg3762828 date=1316995997]

[quote author=Hot_Potato link=topic=517883.msg3762447#msg3762447 date=1316976212]

Using it right now, looks great. Can I access my windows files though?
[/quote]Yes. Go to nautilus (“Home Folder”) and select “File System”. Then find the directory “host” and all of your Window files should be in there.

If you were to dual boot Ubuntu, Windows would just show up as another harddrive under devices.

Thanks, I’m guessing you can’t run .bat files?
[/quote]No. You can run .sh files though but the code is completely different.
[/quote]Not all that different.
To go to a directory you type “cd /directory/” and to run a java applet you type “java applet.jar”

Except the Linux command line is much more powerful than the Windows.[/quote]What?

[quote=“rip4d, post:68, topic:415078”]Except I’m too retarded to make good use of the Linux command line.[/quote]Ubuntu is kind of made for retards. Feels sorta like Ubuntu’s lucid lynx is like “Android” for Computers. Really, you don’t need the Terminal at all. If you need the terminal for something I assure you that you you will find a tutorial, because there’s other Linux retards just like you polluting forums asking millions of questions everyday.

Read full topic
